This highly realistic shooter has a high skill ceiling, a comp and e-sports scene, and a casual scene for player who aren't interested in comp and just want to have huge gun fights. I used to dislike this but then i went into comp with friends and it turned out to be pretty fun. One last thing DO NOT BUY PRIME UNTIL YOUR SKILLS HAVE REACHED A DECENT LVL OF SKILL. The reason i say this is because you either buy prime or get it at a very high level for free, this matches you up with mostly pro players if you have prime. But if you want to stay out of games with hackers be my guest because hackers usually don't buy prime on fake accounts and they usually get banned before reaching level 21.

What is there to say about Counter-Strike? I started playing it in early 2000. During patch 1.3 of original CS.
I played CAL league, and some ESEA back in the days, recruiting on mIRC.

Anyway, this is a classic game, of unrivaled competitive action. Extremely fair, extremely competitive, extremely skill-based. That's why it's been the mainstay of competitive gaming for over 20 years.

There's plenty of fan made maps, mods, and modes, and this game can be played casually, as well.

The skill based gameplay is extremely satisfying, which is why people keep coming back. When you are on fire, and headshotting everybody.. it's amazing. You always are striving to hone your skill in this game. It's never-ending.

This modern incarnation has incredible conveniences of one-button matchmaking, in-game drops, which can be sold for actual value on Steam marketplace.
Yeah.. definitely play this game if you've never tried any FPS, or if you've never tried Counter-Strike.
